thread.title: Penn State football teams defeats Indiana for fifth straight victory
thread.title_full: Penn State football teams defeats Indiana for fifth straight victory - The Morning Call

author: mcall.com
title: Penn State football teams defeats Indiana for fifth straight victory
text:
OFFENSE: B+
See, Christian Hackenberg is a better runner than you thought. He dded two rushing scores to his pair of 39-yard passing TDs. Also completed passes to 8 different players.
DEFENSE: A-
Neutralized the Big Ten's highest-scoring offense to 11 punts, nine after its lone TD. The Lions called it college football's first "no-huddle defense."
SPECIAL TEAMS: C-
Difficult day for kicker Joey Julius, who missed two extra points (without regular holder Chris Gulla) and pulled a kickoff OB. Punter Daniel Pasquariello looked better. Watch those onside kicks.
COACHING: B+
Used play-action effectively and implemented some nicely designed plays, two of which Hackenberg converted into passing TDs. Bob Shoop's defense overall was dominant.
OVERALL: B+
"We just wanted to play as ugly as we possibly could for four weeks, because we were just saving all of that stuff up for this week," coach James Franklin said. Mission accomplished.
